column1: The Court of Appeal took the view that Quit Notice dated 19.10.2011 was null and void
since  the  earlier  Quit  Notice  of  26.08.2005  was  quashed  in  these  proceedings.  This
requires an examination of the facts of those proceedings.
On 26.08.2005, the 1st Respondent served a quit notice (“Quit Notice of 26.08.2005”) on
the Respondent under the Act. Further proceedings under the Act were instituted in the
Magistrate’s Court of Nuwara Eliya Case No. 70451/06.
Thereafter, the Respondent made an application to the Court of Appeal in case No. C.A.

Application  (Writ)  323/06. 
In  those  proceedings,  the  Respondent  sought  a  writ  of

Certiorari  quashing  the  Quit  Notice  of  26.08.2005  and  an 
interim  order  staying  all
proceedings in the Magistrate’s Court of Nuwara Eliya.
The land described in the Quit Notice of 26.08.2005 is as follows:
